p: PI3K and its downstream kinase Akt appear to be important components of LPS-induced activation of the NF-κB signaling pathway. 57 Upon exposure to LPS, PI3K interacts with TRAF6 and actives the downstream target Akt. 58 The activated Akt phosphorylates IKKα, leading to IκB degradation and NF-κB translocation to the nucleus and resulting in specific cytokine gene expression. 59 Consistent with a previous report, 57 our study indicates that the phosphorylated PI3K subunit p85 and Akt (Ser473) are markedly elevated following LPS stimulation. DCEO treatment suppresses the phosphorylation of p85 and Akt in LPS-treated RAW264.7 cells, suggesting that DCEO inhibits LPS-triggered PI3K/Akt signaling, which may, at least partially, contribute to the suppressive effect of DCEO on NF-κB signaling.
